page.title: 02Life in Rathmell North West
page.content: In a farming area,life is centred very much on the farm especially where animals need regular attention. {Work}begins early for the farmer (before 6 a.m.) and at certain times of the year -lambing and haymaking- will involve other members of the family and may end after sunset. Stock is bought and sold on Thusdays at the animal auctions in Hellifield and Gisburn. The farmer's children will attend the local primary{school}but after that will be taken by bus to the Middle or High School in Settle.For {entertainment}they must travel aswell -Young Farmers in Rathmell, youth club in Settle, cinema in Skipton. His wife can{shop}at the village store but for a wider choice must go to Settle(usually on Tuesday,market day),Skipton,Lancaster or Leeds.
